io.github.robolib.iface

Class I2C

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.robolib.iface.Interface
      • io.github.robolib.iface.I2C
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ADXL345_I2C, ArdEx, HMC5883L, MPU6050

    public class I2C
extends Interface
    I2C bus interface class.
    Author:
    Austin Reuland

    • Method Detail

      • free

        public void free()
        Destructor.

      • transaction

        public boolean transaction(byte[] dataToSend,
                           int sendSize,
                           byte[] dataReceived,
                           int receiveSize)
        Generic transaction. This is a lower-level interface to the I2C hardware giving you more control over each transaction.
        Parameters:
        dataToSend - Buffer of data to send as part of the transaction.
        sendSize - Number of bytes to send as part of the transaction.
        dataReceived - Buffer to read data into.
        receiveSize - Number of bytes to read from the device.
        Returns:
        Status of operation (true = success)

      • checkAddress

        public boolean checkAddress()
        Attempt to address a device on the I2C bus. This allows you to figure out if there is a device on the I2C bus that responds to the address specified in the constructor.
        Returns:
        Status of operation (true = success)

      • write

        public boolean write(int reg,
                     int data)
        Execute a write transaction with the device. Write a single byte to a register on a device and wait until the transaction is complete.
        Parameters:
        reg - The address of the register on the device to be written.
        data - The byte to write to the register on the device.
        Returns:
        Status of operation (true = success)

      • writeBulk

        public boolean writeBulk(byte[] data)
        Execute a write transaction with the device. Write multiple bytes to a register on a device and wait until the transaction is complete.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to write to the device.
        Returns:
        Status of operation (true = success)

      • writeBit

        public boolean writeBit(int reg,
                        int bit,
                        byte value)
        write a single bit in an 8-bit device register.
        Parameters:
        reg - Register regAddr to write to
        bit - Bit position to write (0-7)
        value - New bit value to write
        Returns:
        Status of operation (true = success)

      • writeBit

        public boolean writeBit(int reg,
                        int bit,
                        boolean value)
        write a single bit in an 8-bit device register.
        Parameters:
        reg - Register regAddr to write to
        bit - Bit position to write (0-7)
        value - New bit value to write
        Returns:
        Status of operation (true = success)

      • writeBits

        public boolean writeBits(int reg,
                         int bitStart,
                         int length,
                         byte data)
        Write multiple bits in an 8-bit device register.
        Parameters:
        reg - Register regAddr to write to
        bitStart - First bit position to write (0-7)
        length - Number of bits to write (not more than 8)
        data - Right-aligned value to write
        Returns:
        Status of operation (true = success)

      • writeByte

        public boolean writeByte(int reg,
                         byte data)
        Write single byte to an 8-bit device register.
        Parameters:
        reg - Register address to write to
        data - New byte value to write
        Returns:
        Status of operation (true = success)

      • writeWord

        public boolean writeWord(int reg,
                         short data)
        Write single word to a 16-bit device register.
        Parameters:
        reg - Register address to write to
        data - New word value to write
        Returns:
        Status of operation (true = success)

      • writeBytes

        public boolean writeBytes(int reg,
                          byte[] data,
                          int length)
        Write multiple bytes to an 8-bit device register.
        Parameters:
        reg - First register address to write to
        data - Buffer to copy new data from
        length - Number of bytes to write
        Returns:
        Status of operation (true = success)

        Parameters:
        reg - First register address to write to
        data - Buffer to copy new data from
        length - Number of words to write
        Returns:
        Status of operation (true = success)

      • readBit

        public boolean readBit(int reg,
                       int bit,
                       byte[] data)
        Read a single bit from an 8-bit device register.
        Parameters:
        reg - Register regAddr to read from
        bit - Bit position to read (0-7)
        data - Container for single bit value
        Returns:
        Status of read operation (true = success)

      • readBit

        public boolean readBit(int reg,
                       int bit)
        Read a single bit from an 8-bit device register.
        Parameters:
        reg - Register regAddr to read from
        bit - Bit position to read (0-7)
        Returns:
        the value of the bit as a boolean

      • readBits

        public boolean readBits(int reg,
                        int bitStart,
                        int length,
                        byte[] data)
        Read multiple bits from an 8-bit device register.
        Parameters:
        reg - Register regAddr to read from
        bitStart - First bit position to read (0-7)
        length - Number of bits to read (not more than 8)
        data - Container for right-aligned value (i.e. '101' read from any bitStart position will equal 0x05)
        Returns:
        Status of read operation (true = success)

      • readByte

        public boolean readByte(int reg,
                        byte[] data)
        Read single byte from an 8-bit device register.
        Parameters:
        reg - Register regAddr to read from
        data - Container for byte value read from device
        Returns:
        Status of read operation (true = success)

      • readWord

        public boolean readWord(int reg,
                        short[] data)
        Read single word from a 16-bit device register.
        Parameters:
        reg - Register regAddr to read from
        data - Container for word value read from device
        Returns:
        Status of read operation (true = success)

      • readBytes

        public boolean readBytes(int reg,
                         byte[] data,
                         int length)
        Read multiple bytes from an 8-bit device register.
        Parameters:
        reg - First register regAddr to read from
        data - Buffer to store read data in
        length - Number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        Status of read operation (true = success)

      • readWords

        public boolean readWords(int reg,
                         short[] data,
                         int length)
        Read multiple words from a 16-bit device register.
        Parameters:
        reg - First register regAddr to read from
        data - Buffer to store read data in
        length - Number of words to read
        Returns:
        Status of read operation (true = success)

      • read

        public boolean read(int reg,
                    byte[] buffer,
                    int count)
        Execute a read transaction with the device. Read bytes from a device. Most I2C devices will auto-increment the register pointer internally allowing you to read consecutive registers on a device in a single transaction.
        Parameters:
        reg - The register to read first in the transaction.
        buffer - A pointer to the array of bytes to store the data read from the device.
        count - The number of bytes to read in the transaction.
        Returns:
        Status of operation (true = success)

      • readOnly

        public boolean readOnly(byte[] buffer,
                        int count)
        Execute a read only transaction with the device. Read 1 to 7 bytes from a device. This method does not write any data to prompt the device.
        Parameters:
        buffer - A pointer to the array of bytes to store the data read from the device.
        count - The number of bytes to read in the transaction.
        Returns:
        Status of operation (true = success)

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast(int reg,
                      int data)
        Send a broadcast write to all devices on the I2C bus. This is not currently implemented!
        Parameters:
        reg - The register to write on all devices on the bus.
        data - The value to write to the devices.

      • verifySensor

        public boolean verifySensor(int reg,
                            int count,
                            byte[] expected)
        Verify that a device's registers contain expected values. Most devices will have a set of registers that contain a known value that can be used to identify them. This allows an I2C device driver to easily verify that the device contains the expected value.
        Parameters:
        reg - The base register to start reading from the device.
        count - The size of the field to be verified.
        expected - A buffer containing the values expected from the device.
        Returns:
        true if the sensor was verified to be connected
